name: Get Off My Lawn!
description: They came in peace, but messed with the wrong old man. Armed with a musket, 78 year old Murray Mendelson has single-handedly started an interstellar war. Shoot first and ask questions later in this endless fast paced arcade shooter. Use everything in Murray’s arsenal to keep the aliens off of his perfectly manicured lawn!
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7 Processor: Intel Core 2 Duo e6400 or AMD Athlon x64 4000+ Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: Intel HD Graphics 3000 or equivalent DirectX: Version 9.0c Storage: 840 MB available space Sound Card: DirectX Compatible Sound Card
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows 7 Processor: Intel Core i3 - Current Gen Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GT 630 or Radeon HD 7950, or equivalent rated DirectX: Version 9.0 Storage: 1 GB available space Sound Card: DirectX Compatible Sound Card

reviews.review_text: A fun little time-waster that unfortunately wraps itself in blatant monetization; the game has a 'screw you' point at which the difficulty abruptly spikes to insurmountable and literally impossible odds (waves upon waves of armored enemies) without using the for-pay powerups, or grinding through multiple lower-level runs just for enough 'orbs' to buy one. Oh, and of course the powerups are consumables.  Started out feeling fun, but the sweatshop-or-pay quickly came through.  GET OFF MY HARD DRIVE!

I LOVED this game due to graphics and gameplay style.  However, it falls short due to almost being forced to pay micro transactions or pay the penalty of extreme grind. That in my opinion, is one of the biggest downfalls of games nowadays.

Designed to provide a little bit of fun for 5-10 minutes before jacking up the difficulty level to the point where your default pea shooter doesn't work. Surprise, surprise you have to cough up cash to buy the guns necessary to beat this low-budget game with terrible graphics.  Allowing garbage free-to-play mobile junk on Steam just makes me sad. Are you happy now, Gabe? Are you happy what has become of your beloved store?
Its fun at the start but when it ramps up difficulty you really need dem power ups... cost real money though...
This game is extremely repetitive and seems like it is a cheap PC port of a mobile game that was never ment to be on anything other than a mobile device.

Eeeeeeeeeeehh I would call this a bad game, not because the gameplay sucks or anything but because its waaaaaaay too slow at the start and its difficulty is to throw everything it has at you at the same time, giving you no time to react to any of it. I would rather play any of the other 60 games I have than this so i have to give it a 'No' reccomendation.

It's a fun game and it's free to play BUT The thing is,  After level 15 it is really hard to progress,it takes forever to get orbs ( You need them to upgrade your weapons). You would need to farm hours and hours and let's be honest, this game is fun for 30 minutes but farming waves of blue aliens in a frontline gets dull pretty fast...   Also If you want to get 100% achievement you have to pay with real money, no kidding, it is litteraly an achievement in the game...

Nothing says in and ole redneck voice 'GET OFF MY LAND'  A nice free to play defence game! Game is really fun and pretty hard. Some ppl can consider this game p2w if, you want to beat the game in less than an 2 hours. If you have patience's on trying to beat it and not spend real money then you should be able to beat in 6hours or more.  Pros : Gets pretty intense  Upgradable weapons and defense Have side items to help you out 3 guns Aliens look cool  Cons : mobile port No tips for game

This game is a grindfest/P2W, that keeps begging you to waste your hard-earned in-game cash to buy a useless extra life at the end of each game.
this game is a good game and i have no complaints

Fun thing I now use to pass the time while I listen to podcasts. There's in-game purchases, but they're a.) not needed at all to have the full experience and b.) not shoved in your face every 2 minutes. (if I'm not mistaken, you DO have to purchase something to trigger trading card drops, but don't quote me on that.)  Only problems I've had with it is that it takes FOREVER for the game to actually start. You hit Start Game and there's no loading symbol or anything, so I actually thought my game was broken at first when it didn't start my game.

Get Off My Lawn! is an arcade tower defense shooter that pits you against a very orderly alien invasion. The controls are very simple, and can be played with one hand (two might be necessary for younger players). For every alien destroyed, you earn orbs as currency that can be used for power ups and progressively strong weapons. The content is age appropriate for most players (you do use firearms, but no violent deaths).  As with most 'free' games, you can spend real money to buy currency to accelerate your progress in advancement. There is one achievement you can 'earn' by spending real money, so you can see who spent money on this game, and who didn't. If you are an achievement hunter, don't fret, there is only one achievement that you have to buy, and many more that you can get without spending a single penny.
1. OK - IAP Grindfest 10/10 2. The only bonus is the achievements  DEV - make it 1.99 with no micro-transactions.
The main characters dog has white eyebrows and a mustache 10/10 would shoot innocent aliens again
Your game is bad and you should feel bad.  But, seriously, this is one of the most boring and mundane things I've ever done.  Get Off My Lawn? More like Get Off My Computer.

I have only played about 30 minutes when doing this review but I feel like I've experienced the whole game already.  I'm giving this game a recommendation but it barely made it.  So, this game is very basic and feels like an iOS game (it might even be?), it only has one game mode which is a survival game mode with hordes coming at you.  Positives  + Good graphics + Achievements (if you care) + Fun to play when bored  Negatives - An achievement that requires you to make an in-game purchase (really?). - Is too easy at first and then gets too hard too quickly, not a consistent progression from easy to hard. - No languages option, stuck with the Swedish that is horribly translated. - Too high prices on stuff, probably to boost microtransaction sales.  Try it out for yourself, an OK game that might be fun to play once in a while.
this game is Grate the game is so grate that time go past so fast 10/10

I find this game very relaxing after a long day. It is simple to play, loads of fun, and challenging to get an ever higher score. I Highly recommend this game. Between playablity and cuteness of graphics, it keeps me coming back for more.

Very addictive game, it does get old having having to play the same 8 levels over and over again until you can afford any upgrades, and it is a little on the freemium side. I do wish there was a pay version if I wanted to support the developers without buying in game currency. Even with playing level 1 - Death over and over again there is some variety in the pattern of the aliens spawning. With that I do wish every 5-ish levels the scenery would change, as well as the music. It would make for something cool to look at and listen to. Overall a great game and time killer, needs a little more to be amazing without paying the premium price.

Its a 'no brainer' to skip this mindless game.

Its still a better story than twilight. 3. 10x Better than the Call Of Duty Series combined with the Battlefield Series.

Actually a pretty fun game!

When I first saw this game on the Free to Play section, I thought 'Oh look, another crappy F2P, Tower Defense game that has aliens in it'. I then decided, I may as well download the game to at least give it a try, I mean it's free to play right? I was pleasantly surprised by what I had played. The gameplay is smooth, the enemies are actually quick challenging before Level 10 unlike most Tower Defense games, and the concept of the game is very amusing, especially the odd one liners the character says during the game.  The only real complaints I have are the graphics, the rendering of the game and the powerups. Some of the armored aliens sometimes left the armor hovering after they die, the main menu graphics are quite poor. In terms of the powerups, there could be a lot more powerups, and you should be able to access the store mid game instead of waiting for the game over.  However this is a quality game, with good humour and gameplay, and is good for when you want to play a less stressfull game. I would give this a 7.5/10, possibly and 8 if it recieves updates in the future. I seriously reccomend this game for any Indie gamers!
Very addictive little game! LONG LIVE MURRAY!

While a fun and entertaining game to a degree I honestly couldn't recommend this game to anyone. It's fun in small doses and might be even fun for longer periods of time if it wasn't for the fact that the only way to progress through the game is to buy the orbs. All the orbs I have 'earned' through playing the game get lost as soon as I exit to the menu, die, or in any way end the game. That right there is the deal breaker for me. I shouldn't have to pay money to make literally any progress through a game.

Get Off My Lawn is a simple game, but can be entertaining. The story is that and old man named Murray Mendleson has started an intergalactic war, and must use a musket to keep aliens of of his lawn. It is just SO satisfying to shoot down an alien. It reminds me of early iPhone games like Plants vs. Zombies. This game gets 2/5 stars.

A stupid, but fun game. The price is great (I.E. free) and it's wonderful for killing time. It's not a new concept, but still entertaining as the difficulty quickly increases past level 6.  If you are looking to kill some time, this is a great option!
Simple, yet entertaining. Like it a lot!
